description: Single storey lower ground floor rear extension to form a one-bedroom flat and single storey conservatory and roof terrace over lower ground extension
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans:Proposed Section; Proposed West Elevation; Proposed East Elevation; Proposed Upper Ground Floor; and  Proposed North Elevation, all received 19th December 2012.  Proposed Lower Ground Floor One Bedroom Flat, received 4th March 2013.  REASON: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning. | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out only in accordance with the approved details and permanently retained thereafter.  REASON:  To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 7.1, 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan and policies 4.1, 5.5 and 5.9 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 2004: Plan for the Environment | Refuse and recycling storage, in accordance with the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority, shall be provided as shown on the approved plans. Such provision shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved and permanently retained, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.   Reason: To protect the living conditions of residents of the area and in the interests of the environment and the streetscene, in accordance with policies 2.10 and 5.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance Note 4: Refuse and Recycling Facilities and policy 7.6 of the London Plan (2011). | All side facing windows in the extension hereby approved shall be obscure glazed and non-opening below 1.7m above internal floor level and the glazed door in the east elevation of the proposed upper ground floor extension shall be obscure glazed. This arrangement shall be permanently retained.  Reason: To protect the amenity of neighbouring residents, in accordance with policies 7.1, 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan and policies 4.1, 5.5 and 5.9 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (as amended), no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed the extensions hereby approved.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring residents and the visual appearance of the area, in accordance with the policies 4.1, 4.8 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Local Development (Core) Strategy 2012) and policies 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan (2011).
